required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Nalbuphine HCl ER Tablets in Hemodialysis Patients With Uremic Pruritus
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel, 3-Arm Study of the Safety and Anti-Pruritic Efficacy of Nalbuphine HCl ER Tablets in Hemodialysis Patients With Uremic Pruritus

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objectives of the study to evaluate the effects of two doses of nalbuphine HCl ER tablets on the change from baseline in the worst itch Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) in hemodialysis patients with moderate to severe uremic pruritus and to evaluate the safety and tolerability in the study population.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to the Evaluation Period in Itch on the 0-10 Itch Numerical Rating Scale
primary_outcome.description: The evaluation period was defined as the average itch score over weeks 7 and 8 following initiation of treatment. A negative change form baseline (Evaluation Period - Baseline) signified inmprovement.

arm_group.description: nalbuphine HCl ER tablets 60 mg BID
nalbuphine HCl ER tablets 120 mg BID

intervention.intervention_name: nalbuphine HCl ER tablets 60 mg BID
intervention.description: nalbuphine HCl ER tablets 60 mg BID administered for 6 weeks
nalbuphine HCl ER tablets 120mg BID administered for 6 weeks
Placebo tablets BID administered for 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject has been receiving in-center hemodialysis for â‰¥ 3 months and are currently on a schedule of 3 times a week.
- Subject self-categorized themselves on the Patient Assessed Disease Severity Scale during Screening
- Subject meets standard of care hemodialysis efficiency guidelines during the three months prior to completing Screening
- Have demonstrated pruritus intensity on the Itch NRS during screening
- Male or female who are at least 18 years old at the time of Screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject had a significant alteration in dialysis regimen during the Screening Period
- Subject receiving or anticipated to be receiving nocturnal dialysis or home hemodialysis treatment during the study.
- Subject has pruritus that is believed to be caused by a condition unrelated to end-stage renal disease
- Has had a history of substance abuse within 6 months prior to completing Screening
- Subject has a known drug allergy to opioids
- Subject is a pregnant or lactating female.

baseline.population: Of the initial 373 participants randomized, 4 were never treated and, therefore, are not included in baseline demographic or frequency tables of treatment emrgent adverse events (TEAEs). Thus, the number of treated particpants was 369.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to the Evaluation Period in Itch on the 0-10 Itch Numerical Rating Scale
outcome.description: The evaluation period was defined as the average itch score over weeks 7 and 8 following initiation of treatment. A negative change form baseline (Evaluation Period - Baseline) signified inmprovement.
outcome.population: The sample sizes for each arm include participants who had a baseline value and at least one post baseline value for the average itch score during teh Evaluation Period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
